==Japanese==
[[File:Kompas Sofia.JPG|thumb|right|A simple dry magnetic portable compass.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|ら|しん|ばん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Most likely from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=らしんばん}} compound {{m|ltc|羅針盤|tr=la *jim ban|lit=catching needle board||[magnetic] compass}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|cmn|羅針盤}} and simplified {{m|cmn|罗针盘|tr=luózhēnpán}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|ら|しんばん}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɺ̠a̠ɕĩmbã̠ɴ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|らしんばん}}

# a [[compass]], a [[mariner's compass]]
#: Note that this term does not mean the kind of compass used to draw a circle.

* {{ja-l|羅盤|らばん|raban}}
* {{ja-l|コンパス||konpasu}}
